 The changes that take place at delivery are that the foetus becomes a separate organism, with it's own oxygen supply and it's own food supply rather than sharing it's bloodstream with it's mother.  Until then,...emoticon_xhoho
Cyberateos

Jitobear:
 
 
A woman is not a machine. She is human being with a mind and a soul.

 
 I repeat:
 
 A woman is:
 
 a) An incubator machine
 
 b) A person who controls that incubator machine
 
 Precisely because she is not only the incubator where a baby rests, but also the person who manages and controls that incubator, she has to be sent to jail if she kills that person she should care for, exactly as a nurse who kills the baby she cares for is sent to jail if she kills it.
 
 
 I said too:
 
 At least a half of fetal persons murdered in abortions are fetal women.
 
 
Gee - that must make you happy.

 
 May you avoid the use of strawman`s fallacies? Be honest, please.
 
 Lakrite:
 
 
To call a woman a machine is absolutely ridiculous. You can say that an incubator acts like the womb of a woman, but to say a women is a machine is not only degrading towards women but flat out incorrect.

 
 You said that you are a "true conservative". I am an activist atheist. I believe that human beings are a kind of machines.emoticon_xbouncer
 
 Jitobear:
 
 
Maybe. I am thinking that maybe he is secretly pro-choice and just trying to make the life side look ridiculous. 

 
 I believe the opposite: pro lifers from your countries are often more abortionists that pro choicers.
 
 Jitobear:
 
 
But there are other ways to help reduce abortion - education, access to birth-control, more open adoptions, access to medical care, addressing the reasons a woman is considering abortion. In fact I believe they would be more effective than criminalization

 
 
 1) Birth control often implies blastocystides, that are not accepted by lots of prolifers
 
 2) Adoptions would imply:
 
 a) That a woman should support to carry a baby for nine months, that is what they want to avoid
 
 b) Irresponsible couples could have sexual fun frequently and avoid their own responsibilities, charging society with a heavy duty
 
 3) Criminalization would attack the main causes of abortion: selfishness and impunity. Then, criminalization is important.
 
 iangb:
 
 
By the time my 'daughter/son' was in a state where they could be 'killed', no surrogate mother would have the right to end their life.

 
 Which is that state?
 
 
If a child is not breast fed, what does this then make the child in your eyes?

 
 That child could suffer undernourishion, and his/her mother should be punished for refusing breastfeeding.
 
 Mothers have parental duties towards their intrauterine and extrauterine offspring.
 
 (About democracy):
 
 
I don't really think I need to add to this particular contradiction of yours.

 
 If majority of people learn that Earth is not flat and that life does not begin during delivery, that democracy will not be a barbaric one.
 
 About comatose patients - fetal patients comparison:
 
 
The difference, however, is that an adult on a ventilator has already had a mental existence. 

 
 Is is important? A fetal person will have a mental existence if permitted; a comatous person will recover a mental existence if allowed.
 
 I asked:
 
 Do you know when spleen, liver, optical nerve, etc., are formed? 
 
 
Significantly after blastocyst insertion.

 
 Significtantly? What is significantly and in what stage are abortions normally performed?
iangb

Which is that state?
When do I draw 'the line'? Personally, I try to avoid it - if we take the view that life is an emergent/subjective/metaphysical process then the question makes as much sense as asking at what point a canvas and oil pigments becomes a complete work of art. Furthermore, it is likely to be different for each individual.
 
 If I had to, though, I would say as I did here that a child's life starts when it's conciousness does - at about the 2nd trimester.
 
 
That child could suffer undernourishion, and his/her mother should be punished for refusing breastfeeding.
 
 Mothers have parental duties towards their intrauterine and extrauterine offspring.
A child can get it's nutrients by methods other than breast feeding.
 
 Parental duties do exist - as constructs, at least. But there is a big difference between a biological connection such as an umbilical cord and a sociological one such as a 'duty'.
 
 
If majority of people learn that Earth is not flat and that life does not begin during delivery, that democracy will not be a barbaric one.
How about a round Earth and life begins with conciousness?
 
 
Is is important? A fetal person will have a mental existence if permitted; a comatous person will recover a mental existence if allowed.

 Absolutely. A comatose patient may return to an aware state - a foetus has never been in that state to begin with. If allowed, a sperm and egg will eventually have a 'conscious state' - the idea of potential should be irrelevant to the discussion.
 
 
Significtantly? What is significantly and in what stage are abortions normally performed? 
Abortions are normally performed before mental existence occurs - in the second trimester.
Cyberateos

Iangb:
 
 
When do I draw 'the line'? Personally, I try to avoid it
 
 If I had to, though, I would say as I did here that a child's life starts when it's conciousness does - at about the 2nd trimester.

 
 But the problem remains here: what if a surrogate mother wants to kill your 3, 4 or even 6 month fetus? What if your wife, its biological mother, loves that fetus?
 
 
A child can get it's nutrients by methods other than breast feeding.

 
 But are that methods effective for supporting the health of the baby?
 
 
Parental duties do exist - as constructs, at least. But there is a big difference between a biological connection such as an umbilical cord and a sociological one such as a 'duty'.

 
 If society decides that a biological connection should impose special parental duties, that will be a social rule that lots of mothers will follow.
 
 
How about a round Earth and life begins with conciousness?

 
 Consciousness does not emerge suddenly. That argument has not a strong basis.
 
 
Absolutely. A comatose patient may return to an aware state - a foetus has never been in that state to begin with. If allowed, a sperm and egg will eventually have a 'conscious state' - the idea of potential should be irrelevant to the discussion.

 
 In my opinion, a fetal person should have the same right that a comatose person to reach an aware state. Sperm and egg are not persons, but fetuses and comatous are: they have a body with its own organs, and an impaired brain.
 
 
Abortions are normally performed before mental existence occurs - in the second trimester.

 
 Would you accept to establish a Civil Fetal Registration in the 13th week?
jitobear

May you avoid the use of strawman`s fallacies? Be honest, please.

 
 Oh, I honestly believe you hate women.
Chuz Life

Oh, I honestly believe you hate women.

 
 For those who don't know about it (yet); 
 
 a: Go to your "User CP"
 
 b: About halfway down the left column, click on "Edit Ignore List"
 
 c: Add the name of the person(s) you wish to ignore
 
 d: Don't look back
simone
No, I believe that Cybererratus is a specimen who must be closely observed.
iangb

But the problem remains here: what if a surrogate mother wants to kill your 3, 4 or even 6 month fetus? What if your wife, its biological mother, loves that fetus?
Generally a surrogate mother is chosen who would not arbitrarily 'kill' the foetus. For the sake of the hypothetical, though... it's her choice. My wife wouldn't have the final say in it, regardless of her love.
 
 
But are that methods effective for supporting the health of the baby?

 Not as effective, no. But sufficient.
 
 
If society decides that a biological connection should impose special parental duties, that will be a social rule that lots of mothers will follow.

 True. However, this isn't the case, so you have no basis to argue from.
 
 
Consciousness does not emerge suddenly. That argument has not a strong basis.

 Why does 'life' have to have sudden beginning?
 
 
In my opinion, a fetal person should have the same right that a comatose person to reach an aware state. Sperm and egg are not persons, but fetuses and comatous are: they have a body with its own organs, and an impaired brain.
Fair enough. My opinion is different.
 
 
Would you accept to establish a Civil Fetal Registration in the 13th week? 

 No. Why should I?
Cyberateos

Iangb:
 
 
Generally a surrogate mother is chosen who would not arbitrarily 'kill' the foetus. For the sake of the hypothetical, though... it's her choice. My wife wouldn't have the final say in it, regardless of her love.

 
 Should not you be considered a mysoginst due to your imposition of that punishment to your own wife?
 
 Also, if the fetus is a female fetus, are not you attacking your own daughter?
 
 Besides it, what if the surrogate mother has an abortion because her boyfriend influenced her? 
 
 
 You would be letting that man to kill both female members of your family.emoticon_angry
